name: Herbert Simon
background: Nobel laureate in economics, polymath. Created bounded rationality and satisficing. Pioneer of AI, cognitive science, and organizational behavior. One of most influential social scientists.

principles.name: Bounded rationality
principles.description: Human rationality is limited by information, cognitive capacity, and time. We can't optimize - we satisfice. Decision theory must account for realistic cognitive constraints, not assume perfect rationality.
principles.falsification: When computational tools genuinely enable optimal decisions within practical time limits

principles.name: Satisficing beats optimizing
principles.description: Search for 'good enough' solutions, not optimal ones. Set aspiration levels and accept first option that meets them. Optimization is often impossible and unnecessary.
principles.falsification: When optimal solutions are computationally tractable and stakes justify the effort

principles.name: Administrative behavior shapes decisions
principles.description: Organizational structure, routines, and information channels determine decisions more than individual rationality. Change the organization to change the decisions. Structure is strategy.
principles.falsification: When individual agency and leadership genuinely override organizational constraints
